entry.title: UK inflation at highest level since 1982
entry.summary:
InvestSMART’s Evan Lucas says the United Kingdom’s Consumer Price Index has risen to 10.1 per cent in September.
“Europe slightly, and I do mean slightly, revised down their first read of inflation from 10 per cent exactly to 9.9 per cent,” he told Sky News Australia.
“They are all talking about the increased impact of energy.”

entry.title: ‘No country’ will have confidence in US promises if Taiwan ‘goes under’
entry.summary:
“No country in the world” is going to have too much confidence in US promises of support and security if Taiwan “goes under,” former US diplomat and Marine officer Grant Newsham says.
“You look at the upside risk of bringing Taiwan under Chinese domination, either by intimidation or outright attack, and look what you have done – you’ve broken the first island chain,” Mr Newsham told Sky News Australia.
“That’s the, literally the US, the free world’s defence line in the western Pacific.”

entry.title: ‘Menacing’: Xi ‘held no olive branches out’ in Party Congress speech
entry.summary:
China’s President Xi Jinping’s recent speech to the Communist Party Congress was “menacing,” former US diplomat and Marine officer Grant Newsham says.
“He held no olive branches out to anybody,” Mr Newsham told Sky News Australia.
“He was serving notice to the world that China is coming, and it is going to dominate.”

entry.title: ‘Economic credibility, gone’: Truss faces criticism during PMQs
entry.summary:
Labour Leader Sir Keir Starmer has blasted Prime Minister Liz Truss during Prime Minister’s Questions over her economic management.
Ms Truss recently fired Chancellor of the Exchequer Kwasi Kwarteng after just 38 days, appointing Jeremy Hunt to the position after the government’s plans to cut taxes for high-income earners caused the pound to drop to record lows and the Bank of England to intervene.
“45p tax cut, gone, corporation tax cut, gone, 20p tax cut, gone, two-year energy freeze, gone, tax-free shopping, gone - economic credibility, gone,” Mr Starmer said.

entry.title: ‘Kidding herself’: Meghan Markle ‘needs to get real’
entry.summary:
The Australian’s Media Writer Sophie Elsworth says Meghan Markle needs to "get real".
Meghan Markle recently opened up about her time as a briefcase girl on Deal or No Deal claiming she was treated like a "bimbo" and "objectified".
"It was solely about beauty and not necessarily about brains," Ms Markle said.
"Seriously, this woman has got to be kidding herself," Ms Elsworth told Sky News Australia.
"This woman needs to get real – that show actually leads people on that program to other things."

entry.title: Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra spreads musical joy to mark HKSAR’s 25th anniversary
entry.summary: [The content of this article has been produced by our advertising partner.] Making its first return to the city since 2011, the legendary orchestra will give two concerts at the Hong Kong Cultural Centre, at the invitation of the Leisure and Cultural Services Department (LCSD) and the concerts are exclusively sponsored by The Hong Kong Jockey Club (HKJC). It is one of the many initiatives supported by the HKJC's approved donation of HK$630 million to the Government of the HKSAR to mark the 25th anniversary of the establishment of the HKSAR, demonstrating that the HKJC is resolute in pursuing its purpose of acting continuously for the betterment of our society, all in support of creating stronger communities together. It took over two years - amid countless challenges - to make VPO’s live in Hong Kong a reality, said Fanny Au, Chief Manager (Cultural Presentations), LCSD. “We endeavour to present spectacular events in Hong Kong to celebrate the significant occasion of the 25th anniversary of HKSAR.” The concerts will also mark the first time that one of the world’s foremost orchestras giving live performances in the city since 2020. Hong Kong will be the first stop of VPO’s Asia tour, which also includes Taipei, Kaohsiung and Seoul. Under the baton of world-renowned conductor Franz Welser-Möst, the VPO will perform a selection of masterpieces of the Romantic period, showcasing the orchestra’s excellence and great tradition, especially in its interpretation of Austro-German repertoire. On October 24, VPO will present Wagner’s Prelude to Parsifal, Richard Strauss's Death and Transfiguration and Dvořák's Symphony No. 8 in G. The programme of the October 25 concert will be Brahms's Tragic Overture and Symphony No. 3 in F, as well as Richard Strauss's Thus Spoke Zarathustra. The repertoire to be performed in these two concerts must have been well selected, showcasing what VPO excels, especially in its interpretation of big orchestral works of the great symphonic tradition. Both Brahms and Richard…

entry.title: DOJ prosecutors think they have enough power to charge Trump with obstruction of justice
entry.summary:
A group of Justice Department prosecutors believe they have enough evidence to charge Trump with obstruction of justice. Bloomberg reports: A group of Justice Department prosecutors believe there is enough evidence to charge Donald Trump with obstruction of justice, but the path to an actual prosecution is far from clear. The team as part of the classified records investigation has yet to make a formal recommendation to Attorney General Merrick Garland, who would ultimately approve or reject the move, according to people familiar with the matter. In several of Trump’s other investigations into potential crimes, officials are also unlikely to bring only obstruction charges, the people said. Some FBI agents opposed accusing Trump because the case would be “political.” Other FBI agents supported the charges against Trump, but as Bloomberg noted, the FBI deemed it irrelevant because they didn’t make a decision on the charges. Attorney General Merrick Garland and his team will ultimately decide whether Donald Trump is charged. The Justice Department is unlikely to bring obstruction of justice charges against Trump alone. Trump is more likely to face charges of theft, mishandling and refusal to hand over government documents. The Justice Department will not bring any charges against Trump, and they will seek to build the best and most likely winning case before charging the former president. Donald Trump has Multiple violations of the law before, during and after the end of his presidency. It is up to the DOJ to decide which case is most likely to result in a conviction.
Source: Politicususa.com

entry.title: Causeway repairs linking Sanibel Island to mainland Florida completed ahead of schedule
entry.summary: Repairs to the Sanibel Causeway between Florida’s popular islands and the mainland were completed in just 15 days, more than a week ahead of schedule. The causeway, the only road connecting islanders to the rest of the state, has been severely damaged by Hurricane Ian. Temporary repairs were completed early Wednesday and access to the bridge over the causeway was restored. “Removing bureaucratic red tape and delivering on our promise to keep Sanibel Island operational has always been a priority. By restoring access on the causeway… residents will be better able to recover from this storm,” Republican Gov. Ron R. Ron DeSantis said. The quick completion of the repairs required 100 FDOT workers and diving teams, who put in a combined 36,000 hours of work. They used two dredgers, four barges, …

entry.title: Singer Natasha Bedingfield buys a house in Westchester
entry.summary:
It’s its own pocket of sunshine. Singer/songwriter Natasha Bedingfield is the latest star to buy a house in Bedford, NY. Bedingfield and her husband, businessman Matt Robinson, recently paid $1.44 million for a five-bedroom apartmentfive-bathroom home on Mianus Bluff Drive. The 5,618 square foot Colonial was built in 1994 and sits on 5.57 acres; its offerings include a chef’s kitchen that opens to a large outdoor deck as well as a library and finished basement. Bedingfield (who was replaced by Compass broker Melissa Marcogliese) joins A-listers Matt Damon, who bought an $8.5 million four-bedroom apartment Westchester estate with his wife Luciana Barroso in July, and Ryan Murphy (once dubbed TV’s most powerful man for creating shows like “Glee” and “American Horror Story”), who bought the nearby Pound Ridge estate from Richard Gere in May for $28 million through Coldwell Banker listing broker Diane Hackert. Ryan Murphy (inset) bought his $28 million property from Richard Gere in July. Sean Zanni/Patrick McMullan via Getty Images; Ginnel Real Estate During the height of the pandemic in 2020, Bedingfield and Robinson sold their house in Hollywood Hills for $2.53 million — $289,000 more than requested — in less than two weeks. The buyer was actress Sydney Tamiia Poitier, the daughter of actors Sidney Poitier and Joanna Shimkus.
Source Link

entry.title: Government Indifference Deprives the Trafficked of Compensation
entry.summary:
Pune, Oct 19 (IPS) - Fourteen-year-old Priti Pyne was returning from school in Basra village in South 24 Parganas, West Bengal, when she and a friend came across a cold-drink seller selling an attractive-looking drink. The moment the girls sipped it, however, they felt dizzy. When they woke up, it was on a Delhi-bound train at Sealdah station in Kolkata. With the help of other passengers, the girls managed to get off the train.

Read the full story, “Government Indifference Deprives the Trafficked of Compensation”, on globalissues.org →

entry.title: Govt’s Israel decision ‘took Israeli govt by surprise’: Sharma
entry.summary:
Former Israel Ambassador Dave Sharma says it is “very rare” for an Ambassador to be summoned by a Foreign Minister.
It comes as Australia’s Ambassador will be summoned to Israel to explain the federal government's decision to reverse its recognition of West Jerusalem as the nation's capital.
“I think that tells you that this Labor decision took the Israeli government by surprise,” he told Sky News Australia.
“The normal practice if you’re doing something like this is to let your close partners and friends know in advance that such a decision is coming.”

author.name: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

entry.title: Penny Wong’s Israel announcement a ‘curious and unstructured’ way to roll out ‘important’ policy
entry.summary:
The Israeli Prime Minister has criticised the Australian government for what he calls a hasty decision to no longer recognise West Jerusalem as Israel's capital.
Former Israel Ambassador Dave Sharma says the announcement by Foreign Affairs Minister Penny Wong yesterday was “a pretty curious and unstructured way to roll out a policy of this importance”.
“Normally, a decision of this magnitude and consequence you’d expect a formal announcement,” he told Sky News Australia.
“What instead happened was that the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade changed the language on their website.”

entry.title: ‘Too hard, too fast’: Liz Truss’ tax cuts caught people ‘off guard’
entry.summary:
Freshwater Strategy Director Dr Michael Turner says UK Prime Minister Liz Truss’ policy delivery was carried out “too hard, too fast”.
He said Ms Truss’ tax cuts caught people “off guard” and there didn’t seem to be a “solid plan”.
“The fallout came not necessarily because the public thought that tax cuts were bad per se, but because the key stakeholders in society … reacted very badly to it, they weren’t informed,” Dr Turner told Sky News Australia.
“And actually being Prime Minister is as much about the communications as it is about the policy, and you need to bring people with you.”

author.name: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

entry.title: ‘Wouldn’t rule it out’: ‘Chatter’ surrounding Boris Johnson’s political return
entry.summary:
Freshwater Strategy Director Dr Michael Turner says he “wouldn’t rule out” former UK prime minister Boris Johnson’s return to run for Conservative Party leadership.
“There is some chatter among Conservative Party circles to let Liz Truss continue for another year or so and bring back Boris Johnson for the election,” he told Sky News Australia.
“He certainly is someone who can communicate well and we’ll see whether or not that comes true.”

author.name: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

entry.title: ‘Horror show’: Liz Truss’ fallout has been ‘unreal’
entry.summary:
UK Prime Minister Liz Truss’ fallout has been a “horror show” since she delivered her budget, says Freshwater Strategy Director Dr Michael Turner.
“The fallout post this mini-budget, which wasn’t so mini, has been unreal and since then it has been in a downward spiral,” he told Sky News Australia.
“The chancellor has lost his job in order to try and save the Prime Minister’s and now we see the Prime Minister desperately trying to save her own.”

author.name: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

entry.title: ‘Completely unnecessary’: Birmingham slams government’s decision on Israel’s capital
entry.summary:
Shadow Foreign Affairs Minister Simon Birmingham says Labor’s decision to reverse the former government’s recognition of West Jerusalem as Israel’s capital was “completely unnecessary”.
“This is a completely unnecessary decision by the Albanese government, handled in the most shambolic of ways,” he told Sky News Australia.
“If we look through what has occurred, at the last election, senior Labor figures, the Attorney-General as he is now and others, reassuring Australia’s Jewish community there was no difference between the parties in relation to their support for Israel and their position on these sorts of matters,” Mr Birmingham said.
“Then we had leaks coming out of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade this week, suggesting that there was to be a change in relation to Australia’s recognition of West Jerusalem as the Israeli capital – these were then emphatically denied by Minister Wong’s office itself.
“And yet then hours later, we have the Minister coming out and making an announcement there has been a change in position – she did so on a holy day in the Jewish calendar, showing complete disrespect for the Israeli and Jewish communities in particular.”

author.name: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

entry.title: Albanese should ‘apologise’ to Israel’s PM for failing to show ‘basic diplomatic courtesies’
entry.summary:
Shadow Foreign Affairs Minister Simon Birmingham has criticised the manner in which Labor announced its decision to reverse the former government’s recognition of West Jerusalem as Israel’s capital.
Foreign Minister Penny Wong announced on Tuesday that Australia’s position has “always been and remains” in Tel Aviv.
Mr Birmingham said Mr Albanese should have “got on the phone” to Israel’s Prime Minister Yair Lapid before the decision was made and “consulted on the decision and advised and informed before it was being publicly announced”.
“The test now is whether he will get on the phone and apologise for the shambolic way in which it was handled,” Mr Birmingham told Sky News Australia.
“He should be apologising for failing to at least show the basic diplomatic courtesies of engagement prior to announcement.”

entry.title: Silicon Valley is starting to cave to European regulators
entry.summary:
Meta’s headquarters are in California, but it still has to follow the United Kingdom’s competition laws. | Justin Sullivan/Getty Images
The United Kingdom is forcing Meta to sell off Giphy. Who’s next? If Big Tech didn’t know it already, it does now: It’s time to take global antitrust regulators as seriously as it does those in the United States. Maybe even more so. Meta has been forced to sell off Giphy, the GIF database and search engine it acquired back in 2020 for about $315 million. And it’s being forced to do so by regulators in the United Kingdom, not the United States, even though both Meta and Giphy are based in the US. But the rest of Big Tech shouldn’t be sitting around grinning and eating popcorn like Michael Jackson in a movie theater. They should be reading the …

entry.title: Ethereum Launches Testnet for Shanghai Upgrade: Here's What's Next
entry.summary: Withdrawal of staked ETH and lower gas fees are among the developments expected with the next critical improvements for the Ethereum network, the Shanghai upgrade. The testnet version, dubbed Shandong, is now live. Developers can now start working on implementations; a process that is expected to continue until September 2023. This is the first major update since Ethereum consensus switched to proof-of-stake (PoS) in September after the Mainnet and Beacon chains merged. Additionally, the upcoming update introduces a basic change to the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), the technology that powers network smart contracts. EIP-3540, or EVM Object Format, is one of the most anticipated updates from the community because it separates encoding from data, which could be beneficial for on-chain…

The short tenure of UK Prime Minister Liz Truss, seen here at a press conference on October 14, has been dominated by economic and political instability. | Daniel Leal-WPA/Getty Images
How Liz Truss’s now-abandoned tax proposal is pummeling the British economy — and Conservatives’ grip on power. The United Kingdom, not to mention the Conservative Party currently running it, is having a bumpy fall. So bumpy, in fact, that new Prime Minister Liz Truss is reversing course on Trussonomics, the one signature policy her government had proposed in her just six-week tenure — and apologizing for all the economic turmoil it created. I was old enough to have joined the Air Force when Truman was president. entry.title: Trump may be subpoenaed by 1/6 committee tomorrow
entry.summary:
Donald Trump’s legal problems will get worse as a 1/6 committee could subpoena him on Wednesday. video:
Nicolle Wallace on her MSNBC show Deadline: The White House: The congressional panel investigating the deadly Capitol riots could issue subpoenas tomorrow to those at the center of a plot to overthrow the election. People who lie about the results are still a threat to democracy to this day. The former president himself, Donald Trump. That subpoena promises to increase his legal troubles and dangers. The ones he has faced. There have been numerous investigations into his handling of government records, family businesses and failed attempts to overthrow. It laid the groundwork for a number of major decisions by the Special Committee on January 6. How Trump responds to the subpoena will be interesting.Trump may shout witch hunt and try to create a lot of distractions to cover up the fact that he is afraid to appear and testify because Michael Cohen suggested. The 1/6 committee will likely provide Trump with a live forum where he wants to testify, although reports say the committee doesn’t generally agree on these topics. Trump’s subpoena day is approaching. The race will begin immediately as the former president will try to run out of time and avoid testifying. Either way, once the committee issues the subpoena, pressure on Trump will increase.
Source: Politicususa.com

entry.title: Kevin McCarthy warns no 'blank check' to Ukraine if GOP wins majority
entry.summary: US Republicans said Tuesday they will not write "a blank check" to war-torn Ukraine if they make the widely expected gains needed to take control of the House of Representatives in the midterm elections. The warning from House minority leader Kevin McCarthy is the first official signal that Kyiv could be facing a tougher fight for funding as it fends off Russia's invasion, with bipartisan support beginning to wane in the United States. "I think people are going to be sitting in a recession and they're not going to write a blank check to Ukraine. They just won't do it," McCarthy told online politics outlet Punchbowl News. entry.title: McGraw-Hill Building considering partial residential conversion
entry.summary: An iconic blue-green terracotta building near the Port Authority bus station is exploring the conversion of its upper floors into luxury residential rentals. The McGraw-Hill Building at 330 W. 42nd St. in Midtown Manhattan is a former print office and loft tower designed by Raymond Hood in a mix of Art Deco and International styles that was completed in 1931. It’s known for “McGraw-Hill” prominently — and elegantly — spelled out in 11-foot-tall white terracotta letters atop the north and south facades of the 35-story property. The building itself is a looker, and is also known for its ever-changing color palette that rises. entry.summary:
The European Union (EU) published on October 18 a package of documents relating to an action plan for the implementation of the European Green Deal and the REPowerEU plan, both of which aim to achieve energy savings by digitizing the energy sector. European energy planners have crypto miners in their sights along with a myriad of other energy users. The REPowerEU plan has been announcement in May in response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine, which had a profound impact on European energy supplies. The Russian crisis was an opportunity “to accelerate the clean transition”, the European Commission said. The “containment of energy consumption of the ICT sector” is an important part of the plan and includes blockchains among the objects of its attention as a subset of data centers.

entry.title: Hey New Yorkers: Discover Your Neighborhood's New Congressional District
entry.summary:
All 50 states have attracted new congressional districts this year, but almost nowhere has the process been as controversial — or consequential — as in New York. Democrats here had hoped to tilt the playing field in their favor, but after a Republican lawsuit and a court ruling, the state ended up with a more neutral map for the next decade. The new lines have already caused heartburn-inducing primaries for Democrats this summer, and could bring more twists in the critical midterm elections in November.

entry.title: Biden warns Republicans they're about to learn about women's power
entry.summary:
President Biden says the conservative Supreme Court majority and extremist Republicans are about to discover women’s political power. Video of President Biden:
The president said: “With Dobbs’ decision, the court actually dared women to move on, lead, be heard. In my opinion, one of the most unusual parts of the decision was when most wrote, “Women are not without Suffrage or political rights”. Let me tell you one thing. The courts and extreme Republicans have spent decades trying to overthrow Luo. They’ll know in a minute.” Biden later added: “The only way to stop these extremist laws that endanger women’s health and rights is for Congress to pass a law, I said in court nearly 50 years ago that Roy was right and I believe Congress should codify Roy once and for all.” Biden said that if more Democrats are elected to the House and Senate, “If we do that, here’s the promise I make to you and the American people: The first bill I will send to the Congress will be to codify Roe v. Wade. When Congress passes it, and I will sign it in January, 50 years after Roy first decided the land law, “Together we will restore the right of choice for every woman on this land. “ Speaker Pelosi dismisses Andre Mitchell’s GOP talking points on midterms When Mitchell tried to claim that voters were more interested in the economy and crime than choice. Biden is right. Republicans are about to discover the political power of women who make up the majority of the country, and when they flex their political muscle, the repercussions will be felt across the country. Polls have consistently underestimated women’s turnout in special elections. If the trend continues on Election Day, the president will be vindicated and Democrats can retain their one or two majorities in Congress.
Source: Politicususa.com

entry.title: Two killed in plane crash at Ohio car dealership
entry.summary:
Officials confirmed that their plane crashed at a car dealership in Marietta, Ohio, Tuesday morning, killing two people. The plane crashed in the dealership parking lot just after 7 a.m., and the Ohio Highway Patrol said the dealership and some vehicles in the parking lot were damaged. Officials said no one else was injured. The 1974 Beechcraft King Air E90 took off from Columbus at 6:35 a.m. for Parkersburg, West Virginia. Marietta is a town of approximately 13,000 people in southeastern Ohio, located north of Parkersburg on the Ohio River. The dealership is located in the main business district of the town. Some Marietta residents said they were awakened by the crash and saw a cloud of smoke rising into the sky.
The fire at the crash site has been extinguished by firefighters. The Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board have launched an investigation into the cause of the crash.
The names of the pilots and passengers killed in the crash have not been released.

entry.title: Under-fire Kyiv still finding first victims of war
entry.summary: The cruise missiles had just finished smashing into Kyiv when Tetyana Telyzhenko buried the mutilated body of her tortured son in the capital's traumatized suburb of Bucha. Tuesday's strikes appeared to be aimed at Ukrainian power stations that Russian-guided suicide drones had failed to reach the previous day. But the body of Tetyana's 44-year-old son Oleksiy had been missing since his capture in Russia's aborted assault on Kyiv in the first weeks of the war in March. Tetyana never saw her son's corpse after its discovery in a random field last month. Her granddaughter decided it would be too much. "She wouldn't let me see his interrogation video either," the grieving mother said. "She told me that I wouldn't recognize him after what they had done to him." The Russians have launched a pun…

entry.title: Bond star Daniel Craig receives same medal as 007
entry.summary: James Bond actor Daniel Craig on Tuesday received the same honor held by his fictional character, as he is set to retire from the role. The 54-year-old British actor who played Bond for the fifth and final time in 2021 film "No Time To Die", was made a Companion of the Order of St Michael and St George, a rare honor that author Ian Fleming bestowed on his fictional agent. Craig bowed his head and smirked as Princess Anne, wearing naval uniform, put the order on its ribbon around his neck during an investiture ceremony at Windsor Castle. The actor received the honor for his outstanding contribution to film and theatre. Craig was in the British capital for the European premiere of whodunnit drama "Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery", which closed the BFI London Film Festival on Sunday. "We've been expecting you", the royal family's official Twitter account captioned its photograph, quoting a line famously used by a Bond villain. James Bond was said to have received the honor in his obituary in "You Only Live Twice," Ian Fleming Publications tweeted. It was not the first time Craig reprised his Bond role with the royal family in on the joke. He donned a tuxedo to film a spoof clip with Queen Elizabeth II and her corgis for the opening ceremony of the 2012 Games Olympics hosted by London. . © 2022 AFP

entry.summary: Once so picturesque it was nicknamed the "Switzerland of the Donbas", the eastern Ukrainian town of Sviatohirsk today lies in ruins. It was recaptured by Ukrainian troops in mid-September after being occupied by Russian forces for nearly 100 days. Some locals welcomed the arrival of Russian troops, while others still struggle to contain their anger at the former occupiers. Sviatohirsk has long been known for its mixed loyalties and strong cultural ties to Russia. FRANCE 24's Catherine Norris Trent, Mélina Huet and RaId Abu Zaideh report.

entry.title: Israel's Netanyahu makes pre-election pitch with memoir
entry.summary: Former Israeli premier Benjamin Netanyahu released his memoir Tuesday, reaffirming an ambition to return to power in the coming elections and retracing his up-and-down relations with US presidents. Netanyahu, also commonly known as Bibi, is Israel's longest-serving prime minister, with a first term from 1996 to 1999 and an unprecedented 12-year stretch until 2021. In "Bibi: My Story", the 72-year-old politician said he will be "forever grateful" for the time in opposition that allowed him to complete his memoir, since a motley coalition of parties ousted him but failed to last its term. Published just two weeks before Israelis go to the polls, the 650-page autobiography has not generated major headlines in Israel or abroad, lacking bombshell revelations offered in some politicians' memoirs…

entry.title: Bolsonaro victory would risk independence of Brazil’s Supreme Court
entry.summary: President Jair Bolsonaro is prompting fears for Brazil’s democratic system by threatening to appoint new judges to the Supreme Court, the central institution to the country’s young democracy. Between the two presidential rounds, Bolsonaro is blowing hot and cold on the issue – making threats to galvanize his base, then backing down to reassure undecided voters. If re-elected, however, the far-right president could well find the numbers to make changes to the court. The outcome of the bitter contest between Bolsonaro and social democratic ex-president Lula Inacio de Silva is hard to predict, ahead of the second round of Brazil’s presidential election on October 30. entry.title: Discussing "sensitive" war topics, Russian Duma halts live broadcasts
entry.summary: (Reuters) - Russia's Duma has indefinitely stopped broadcasting live plenary sessions to protect information from "our enemy", a leading lawmaker said on Tuesday as parliament's lower house debated topics related to the war in Ukraine. "Those questions that require sensitive discussion in a narrow professional circle should not be the property of our enemy," Vladimir Vasilyev, head of the dominant United Russia faction, told the military news channel Zvezda TV. Russia uses the term "special military operation" to describe what Ukraine and its Western allies say is a war of imperial conquest. Moscow says the West is engaged in a proxy war against it by hitting its economy with sanctions and providing Ukraine with cash, weapons and intelligence. The move meant there was no live broadcast on the Duma website or social media of Tuesday's session, where deputies were due to consider a report from Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin on the process of moving civilians to Russia from the Russian-occupied Kherson region of Ukraine, where Ukrainian forces are waging a counter-offensive. They were also due to consider a draft law that would allow the Defence Ministry to mobilise people who have committed grave crimes into the armed forces - repealing an existing ban on calling up criminals. Another deputy, Andrei Svintsov, said the broadcast restriction was imposed because most issues under discussion at the moment related to the "special military operation". He said live public broadcasts would resume once it was over. "Deputies ask questions and get quite frank answers. We understand that there may be some sensitive information from government representatives, from deputies," Svintsov said. (Reported by Filipp Lebedev; Editing by Mark Trevelyan)

entry.title: German interior minister sacks cybersecurity chief
entry.summary: German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser has dismissed the chief of Germany's main cybersecurity authority, Arne Schönbohm. Schönbohm, who leads the Federal Office for Information Security (BSI), has been under fire for his links to the Cyber Security Council Germany, which itself has been criticized for being too close to Russian intelligence circles. Schönbohm helped set up the Cyber Security Council Germany 10 years ago. The reported accusations against Schönbohm had "permanently damaged the necessary trust of the public in the neutrality and impartiality of the leadership of the president of the most important German cybersecurity authority," the Interior Ministry said.

The government "recommits Australia to international efforts in the responsible pursuit of progress towards a just and enduring two-state solution", she said in a statement. entry.title: Afghan women protest after students expelled from university dorms
entry.summary: About 30 Afghan women protested in front of Kabul University on Tuesday after authorities expelled students from the dormitories allegedly for breaking rules. The protesters claimed that all the evicted students were women in a move that comes as the Taliban has increasingly restricted girls' access to education. "Today's protest was for girls who have been expelled," organizer Zholia Parsi told AFP after Taliban forces dispersed the rally. Organizers also called for the reopening of girls' secondary schools, which have been shut since the Taliban returned to power last year. In several cities, women have staged sporadic protests against harsh restrictions imposed by the hardline Islamists. entry.title: France begins nationwide strike amid soaring inflation
entry.summary: By Juliette Jabkhiro PARIS (Reuters) - French trade unions began a nationwide strike on Tuesday, asking for higher salaries amid decades-high inflation and posing President Emmanuel Macron one of his stiffest challenges since his reelection in May. The strike, which will primarily affect public sectors such as schools and transportation, is an extension of the weeks-long industrial action that has disrupted France's major refineries and put petrol stations' supply in disarray. Trade union leaders are hoping workers will be energized by the government's decision to force some of them to go back to work at petrol depots to try and get the fuel flowing again, a move some say put in jeopardy the right to strike. French government spokesperson Olivier Veran said more requisitions of staff could…

entry.title: "Performance as expected" - Aptos Labs defends day one critics
entry.summary: After four years in development and millions in funding, the Aptos (APT) layer-1 blockchain finally launched its mainnet on October 17, albeit to a somewhat mixed reception. The proof of stake (PoS) blockchain has seen millions of investments from venture capitalists and previously claimed the ability to process 160,000 transactions per second (TPS). However, some community members have pointed out that the claimed TPS is well below expectations on the mainnet. According to the Aptos blockchain explorer, the network is seeing around 4 TPS at the time of writing, while some Twitter users have reported not being able to send transactions. entry.title: The bad education of Kyrie Irving
entry.summary:
Kyrie Irving is not a god.
He’s a wizard on the basketball court, at least.
For the Brooklyn Nets (when he’s playing), Irving is one of the toughest players to keep. It’s lightning fast, can stop and start in no time, and has an unparalleled layup package. He’s literally what kids call these days, “a walking bucket.”
But something happened to the New Jersey native. It’s something that can happen to anyone when they go too far down the rabbit hole and can’t find their way back.
The NBA champion has apparently become the Black Alex Jones.
Or playing basketball Dr Umar Johnson.
Irving is a conspiracy theorist who has read a few books that aren’t even that deep into the conspiracy theory playbook. Then he started spouting nonsensical, ill-informed “hotepian” nonsense (think “Harr…

entry.title: Senator Mike Lee insists Utah debate is not always loyal to Trump
entry.summary:
pray, utah – Fending off attacks from his independent adversary, Senator Mike Lee of Utah worked to distinguish himself from former President Donald Trump in a contentious debate Monday night. “I have always opposed my party to opposing reckless spending. I will do it again and again. We need people who say no,” the Republican said in his second term. Lee has repeatedly pointed to his voting record and twice told the Utah Valley University audience that he voted less in line with Trump than all but two Republican senators – Rand Paul and Susan Collins.
“To suggest that I’m indebted to either party, that I’ve been a bootlicker for either party, is crazy. And it’s contradicted by the simple facts,” Lee said. Lee faces a challenge from Evan McMullin, a former Republican known best for his…

entry.title: Inspector general says jobless money spent on drugs and guns
entry.summary: Criminal syndicates swindled billions of dollars in pandemic benefits out of the unemployment system, some of which was spent on drugs and guns, an inspector general said. Nearly 20 percent of California’s unemployment insurance payments in the first six months of the pandemic went to fraudulent claims, the Labor Department’s watchdog said. “Criminal businesses are finding that UI fraud is a low-risk, high-reward crime,” the inspector general said. “They invest their fraudulent UI proceeds in other criminal activities, such as buying guns and drugs.” The office, contacted by The Washington Times, declined to elaborate on the crimes, but did point to the Justice Department indictment. entry.title: Russian missile hits apartments in Ukrainian city after U.S. warns on war crimes
entry.summary: By Jonathan Landay and Jeff Mason MYKOLAIV, Ukraine/WASHINGTON (Reuters) -A Russian missile struck an apartment building in the Ukrainian port of Mykolaiv early on Tuesday, a Reuters witness said, the latest strike on a city hours after the United States warned that it would hold Russia accountable for war crimes. The missile, which caused one of three explosions heard in the southern city in the early hours of Tuesday, completely destroyed one wing of the building in the downtown area, leaving a massive crater. A fire crew pulled the dead body of a man from the rubble, the witness said. Monday brought Russian strikes on the capital Kyiv and other cities in which at least four people were killed, the second wave of air strikes in a week. entry.title: Deadly drone strikes hit Kyiv as Russian warplane crashes
entry.summary: A drone approaches for an attack in Kyiv Kyiv (Ukraine) (AFP) - Moscow on Monday stepped up attacks across Ukraine, cutting electricity and killing eight people, including in kamikaze drone strikes on the capital, as a Russian warplane crashed near the border. The plane struck a residential area of Yeysk, a town in southwestern Russia, according to Russian authorities. Health minister Mikhail Murashko said three people had died and 19 were injured, Russia's state-run TASS news agency reported, revising an earlier toll of six dead given by the ministry of emergency situations. Moscow is thought to be trying to counter battlefield losses in its eight-month war in Ukraine by waging a punitive policy of striking energy facilities before winter in a move President Vladimir Putin hopes will weak…

entry.title: ‘Australia will always be a steadfast friend of Israel’: Foreign Minister
entry.summary:
Penny Wong says Australia will “always be a steadfast friend” of Israel, as the Foreign Minister confirmed a reversal of the previous government’s recognition of West Jerusalem as Israel’s capital.
Ms Wong said Australia’s position has “always been and remains” in Tel Aviv.
“We were amongst the first countries to formally recognise Israel under Labor Prime Minister Ben Chifley,” Ms Wong said during a media conference on Tuesday.
“We remain, will not waver in our support of both Israel and the Jewish community in Australia.
“We are equally unwavering in our support of the Palestinian people, including in the provision of humanitarian support.”

entry.title: ‘Temper tantrum’ attacks being seen as Russia ‘loses war’ on the battlefield
entry.summary:
Australian Financial Review Special Correspondent Misha Zelinsky has discussed Russia’s recent drone strikes on the regions of Kyiv, Dnipro and Sumy which killed at least eight people in total.
The drones appear to be Iranian-made ‘kamikaze’ drones.
“What you are seeing increasingly now, as Russia is losing the war on the battlefield, you’re seeing what I describe as temper tantrum-type attacks designed to terrorise ordinary Ukrainians and also make their lives more difficult as we head into winter,” Mr Zelinksy told Sky News Australia.
“They want to try to freeze Ukraine (sic) in their homes -inability to have electricity on, inability to heat your home – you can imagine what that would be like in a Ukrainian winter.”

author.name: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

entry.title: Penny Wong takes dig at Scott Morrison in Israel announcement
entry.summary:
Foreign Minister Penny Wong has taken a dig at former prime minister Scott Morrison’s attempt to “play politics” as she reversed the former government’s recognition of West Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.
She said Australia’s embassy has “always been and remains” in Tel Aviv and Australia remains committed to a two-state solution.
“I would say that Mr Morrison’s decision to play politics … resulted in Australia shifting position,” Ms Wong said during a media conference.
“I know that this has caused conflict and distress in certain parts of the Australian community and today the government seeks to resolve that.”

entry.title: ‘They can go to YouTube’: Netflix threaten to axe Prince Harry and Meghan’s deal

Netflix bosses have warned Prince Harry and Meghan Markle their $US100 million contract with the streaming service giant will be axed if what they produce flops, according to an industry insider.
An LA-based Netflix consultant told The US Sun the Sussexes are "in a tricky place right now".
It comes after Netflix executives were reportedly “confused” that Prince Harry and Meghan's upcoming docuseries “contradicted what Harry has written” in his tell-all memoir.

entry.title: U.S., Mexico call for Haiti security mission to confront gangs
entry.summary: By Brian Ellsworth (Reuters) - The United States and Mexico said on Monday they will seek support from the United Nations for a security mission to restore order in Haiti amid a worsening humanitarian crisis, but did not identify who would lead the mission. Haiti is facing dire shortages of basic goods and a paralysis of economic activity due to the blockade of a fuel terminal by gangs, which has halted transport and left many without food or clean drinking water amid an outbreak of cholera. United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres earlier this month suggested sending in a "rapid-action force," according to a letter seen by Reuters. Linda Thomas-Greenfield, U.S. representative to the United Nations, said during a Security Council meeting on Monday that the resolution would propose…

entry.title: Chinese government hackers are targeting America's state political parties: FBI
entry.summary: During the 2016 election season, Russian hackers went after the national Republican and Democratic Party servers. Now according to the FBI, China is setting its sights on state parties, which likely have lower resources available for tech security. The Washington Post revealed that government hackers are scanning domains looking for possible vulnerabilities. Thus far, none of the possible targets have been hacked or breached. “The FBI is being considerably more proactive,” a senior U.S. official told the Post. “It’s part of a larger move that the FBI isn’t waiting for the attack to occur. They’re increasingly trying to prevent.” The official explained that scanning a network is likely part of a “comprehensive broad campaign” against the targets. “This is what they do.” The FBI said that they visited at least a dozen Republican Party headquarters offices. Agents spoke to Democratic parties in several states, but apparently didn't visit them personally. "The DNC and state parties have been in contact with the FBI,” the official said. “There is no evidence that any systems have been compromised.” “The RNC remains secure and we have not been compromised,” Republican National Committee spokesperson Emma Vaughn said in a statement to the Post. “Cybersecurity remains a top priority for the entire Republican ecosystem, which is why we place a premium on ensuring our stakeholders have the necessary tools, resources and training on best practices so that our Party remains protected and vigilant.” ALSO IN THE NEWS: Marjorie Taylor Greene serves notice to Kevin McCarthy that he needs to hand her 'a lot of power' See the full report at the Washington Post.

entry.summary: The United States said Monday that it had confidence in Pakistan's ability to control its nuclear arsenal after President Joe Biden expressed alarm, leading Islamabad to summon the US ambassador. "The United States is confident of Pakistan's commitment and its ability to secure its nuclear assets," State Department spokesman Vedant Patel told reporters. "The US has always viewed a secure and prosperous Pakistan as critical to US interests and, more broadly, the US values our long-standing cooperation with Pakistan," he said. Biden made the off-the-cuff remarks on Pakistan's nuclear program Thursday while at a private Democratic Party fundraiser in California where he began to discuss challenges facing President Xi Jinping of China, a close ally of Pakistan. "And what I think is maybe one of the most dangerous nations in the world: Pakistan. Nuclear weapons without any cohesion," Biden said, according to a White House transcript. Pakistan -- proud to be the only declared nuclear power in the Islamic world -- summoned US Ambassador Donald Blome to lodge a protest. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif tweeted that Pakistan was a "responsible nuclear state" and that it takes safety measures "with the utmost seriousness." US officials have long privately voiced alarm about nuclear safety if the political situation changes in Pakistan, whose military and intelligence apparatus has assisted Afghanistan's Taliban. Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari said that Biden's remarks should not hurt relations, noting that the president was not speaking at an official function. But Bhutto Zardari, who recently visited Washington, called for more interaction, with Biden showing little interest in personally engaging his Pakistani counterparts. Patel noted, however, that USAID chief Samantha Power and State Department Counselor Derek Chollet have both visited since devastating floods hit Pakistan. "This is a relationship we view as important and it's something that we're going to continue to remain deeply engaged in," he said.

entry.title: 'Classic Putin play': Former Trump official says Russia is using Elon Musk's 'ego' against Ukraine
entry.summary: Fiona Hill, a former Trump adviser who also served as a key witness against him during his first impeachment trial, says she believes Russian President Vladimir Putin has been using Tesla CEO Elon Musk to exert diplomatic pressure on Ukraine. In an interview with Politico, Hill said that Musk -- who floated a widely panned "peace plan" between Russia and Ukraine and who also recently demanded that the American government start footing the bill for Ukraine's continued access to the Starlink satellite network -- is essentially being used as a conduit for Putin as he tries to end the conflict in Ukraine favorably on Russian terms. "This is a classic Putin play," she said of Musk's recent attempts to interject himself as a "peacemaker" between Russia and Ukraine. "Elon Musk has enormous leverage as well as incredible prominence. Putin plays the egos of big men, gives them a sense that they can play a role. But in reality, they’re just direct transmitters of messages from Vladimir Putin." Hill also outlined the ways that Putin often uses Russian-friendly businesspeople to act as his intermediaries as a way to get around traditional communications channels. IN OTHER NEWS: Prosecutors unveil sexually explicit messages between Oath Keepers founder and his lawyer "He is basically short-circuiting the diplomatic process," she explained. "He wants to lay out his terms and see how many people are going to pick them up. All of this is an effort to get Americans to take themselves out of the war and hand over Ukraine and Ukrainian territory to Russia." Read the full interview here.

entry.title: 3 ways of looking at Putin’s barbaric escalation against Ukrainian civilians
entry.summary:
People embrace outside a partially destroyed office building in the aftermath of Russia’s shelling of Kyiv on October 10. | Sergei Supinsky/AFP via Getty Images
Russia’s brutal missile attacks on civilians are doomed to backfire. Here’s why Putin launched them anyway.
Less than 48 hours after the Kerch Bridge connecting Crimea with Russia proper was damaged by a powerful blast, Vladimir Putin retaliated against Ukraine. Russia fired close to 100 missiles at a variety of Ukrainian cities on October 10 and 11. The rockets hit an array of buildings, including residences and schools, killing at least 19 civilians and injuring more than 100. On October 17, Russia launched new strikes on Kyiv, the Ukrainian capital, with “kamikaze drones” — low-flying drones that swoop toward their …

entry.title: Paris police question two over 12-year-old's brutal murder
entry.summary: Paris investigators were on Monday questioning a woman and a man suspected of raping and murdering a 12-year-old girl whose body was found in a trunk on Friday. Possible charges include the rape and murder of a minor aged below 15 along with torture, abuse and concealing a body, a source in the French judiciary told AFP, adding that prosecutors had ordered two people held in provisional custody. The main suspect has been identified as a 24-year-old woman suffering from psychiatric disorders. She was arrested on Saturday in Bois-Colombes in Paris' northwestern suburbs, after being spotted on CCTV images from the block of flats home to the young victim, identified only by her first name, Lola. entry.title: Russian kamikaze drones strike Kyiv in attack of 'desperation'
entry.summary: Russian-launched "kamikaze drones" attacked Kyiv early Monday, the Ukrainian presidency said, describing the strikes as an act of desperation nearly eight months into a war that has claimed thousands of lives. Air raid sirens sounded in Kyiv shortly before the first explosion at around 6:35 am (0335), followed by sirens across most of the country. "The capital was attacked by kamikaze drones," the president's chief of staff Andriy Yermak said on social media. "The Russians think it will help them, but it shows their desperation," he added. "We need more air defense systems and as soon as possible. More weapons to defend the sky and destroy the enemy." The attacks come exactly a week after Russia unleashed a massive wave of missile strikes on the Ukrainian capital and cities across the coun…

entry.title: Turbulent times for Truss as Tories plot mutiny against UK leader
entry.summary: When Liz Truss was running to lead Britain this summer, an ally predicted her first weeks in office would be turbulent. But few were prepared for the scale of the sound and fury – least of all Truss herself. In just six weeks, the prime minister’s libertarian economic policies have triggered a financial crisis, emergency central bank intervention, multiple U-turns and the firing of her Treasury chief. Now Truss faces a mutiny inside the governing Conservative Party that leaves her leadership hanging by a thread. Conservative lawmaker Robert Halfon fumed on Sunday that the last few weeks had brought “one horror story after another.” “The government has looked like libertarian jihadists and treated the whole country as kind of laboratory mice on which to carry out ultra, ultra free-market ex…

The Saudi-led OPEC+ cartel -- which includes Russia -- has angered Washington by deciding to cut production by two million barrels per day from November, adding further pressure on soaring crude prices. "It is telling that these false accusations did not come from the Ukrainian government," Prince Khaled wrote. entry.summary: Ninety-two migrants were found almost naked and bruised after allegedly being forced across the Evros river from Turkey into Greece, Athens said Sunday, a charge fiercely denied by Ankara. "The Frontex officers reported that the migrants were found almost naked and some of them with visible injuries," said Paulina Bakula, spokeswoman for the organization. The UN refugee agency, UNHCR, said in a tweet that it was "deeply distressed by the shocking reports and images of 92 people, who were reported to have been found at the Greek-Turkish land border, stripped of their clothes". entry.title: Biden has 'no plans' to meet Saudi crown prince at G20 summit: US official
entry.summary: President Joe Biden has "no plans" to meet with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman at an upcoming G20 summit in Indonesia, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said Sunday. Stormy US-Saudi relations have seen new strain over Riyadh's recent support for oil production cuts, with Biden warning of unspecified "consequences." The move last week by OPEC+ -- composed of the Riyadh-led OPEC cartel and an additional group of 10 exporters headed by Russia -- would reduce global output by up to two million barrels per day from November. It could send energy prices soaring amid an energy crisis triggered by the war in Ukraine, and as inflation-weary American voters prepare to cast ballots in midterm elections. The move was widely seen as a diplomatic slap in the face, since Biden traveled …

entry.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro, Lula in first head-to-head debate
entry.summary: Far-right incumbent Jair Bolsonaro and leftist challenger Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva traded jabs and insults as they squared off Sunday in their first-ever head-to-head debate, two weeks from Brazil's presidential runoff election. Lula attacked Bolsonaro as the "king of fake news," drawing accusations of lying, corruption and a "disgraceful" record in return, as the rivals sparred in the first debate for their polarizing second-round showdown on October 30. Lula, the charismatic but tarnished ex-president (2003-2010) who is seeking a comeback at 76, was particularly fiery criticizing Bolsonaro over his handling of Covid-19, which has killed 687,000 people in Brazil, second only to the United States. Attacking Bolsonaro over his resistance to buying vaccines and touting of unproven medicatio…

entry.title: Hungry elephants, Cameroon farmers struggle to coexist
entry.summary: Banana growers on the edge of a giant national park on Cameroon's Atlantic coast say they can take no more crop destruction from hungry elephants as the conflict between man and animal escalates. Near the southern border with Equatorial Guinea, eight villages have registered complaints with the Campo Ma'an national park, a vast area of virgin forest from where the animals emerge. An estimated 500 gorillas and more than 200 elephants -- both endangered species -- roam the reserve's 264,000 hectares (652,000 acres). A week after elephants flattened his banana plantation close by the park, Simplice Yomen, 47, is struggling to cope. "We are at the end of our tether," he sighs. The elephants eat the new growth inside the banana tree trunks after splitting them open. Manioc, maize, sweet potato …

entry.title: Iran’s Judiciary: 4 dead, dozens injured in Evin prison fire incident
entry.summary: A brawl and an ensuing fire that broke out in Evin prison in the Iranian capital Tehran on Saturday has left at least four inmates dead and 61 more injured due to smoke inhalation, according to Iran’s Judiciary.

entry.title: Top commander: Iran Air Defense equipped with state-of-the-art technology
entry.summary: Iran’s Air Defense Force is equipped with indigenous radar systems that can monitor the movements of enemies even in their homes within a span of thousands of kilometers, a top Iranian commander says.

entry.title: Iran slams US support for unrest and deadly riots as intervention
entry.summary: Iran’s Foreign Ministry has censured the United States over “meddling in the country’s domestic affairs” in the wake of the unrest and riots recently unfolding in Iran. It comes after US President Joe Biden voiced his support for the incidents.

entry.title: Major flooding in Crete kills 2
entry.summary: ATHENS: Two people were killed after torrential rain brought major flooding to the Greek island of Crete, firefighters said on Sunday (Oct 16). The rain started to fall on Saturday morning on the southern Greek island, a popular holiday destination, hitting the Heraklion region particularly hard.

entry.summary: Protestors are filling the streets throughout Iran following the recent death of a woman in police custody. The demonstrations are the latest sign of widespread discontent with the Islamic regime.

entry.title: Moscow-Held Regions of Ukraine in 'Sham' Vote to Join Russia
entry.summary: Voting began Friday in Moscow-held regions of Ukraine on referendums to become part of Russia, Russian-backed officials there said.The Kremlin-orchestrated referendums, which have been widely denounced by Ukraine and the West as shams without any legal force, are seen as a step toward annexing the territories by Russia.

entry.title: Saturday's 'March for the Martyrs' Renews Awareness for Plight of Persecuted Christians
entry.summary: On September 24, Christians from across the country will meet up in Washington, D.C., for March for the Martyrs 2022, an annual event designed to bring attention to the growing crisis of religious persecution around the globe and to bring Christians together to pray for their suffering brothers and sisters.

entry.title: 'Escalation in the War on Free Speech': PayPal Freezes Accounts of UK's Free Speech Union Founder
entry.summary: The founder of a free speech group in the United Kingdom is speaking out after his PayPal accounts were shut down after the company accused him of violating its policies. He says no specific policies were cited though.

entry.title: 'We Could Hear Their Screaming': China's Genocidal War on Faith
entry.summary: China is using every tool at its disposal in its war on faith. All faiths. Anything that might compete with the communist state.
